sourceMeaningMnemonic: When you go on a <radical>scooter</radical>, anything <radical>valuable</radical>, you need to <kanji>leave behind</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Rings, necklaces, wallets, phones? Don't take them on a scooter. Leave behind all that valuable stuff!
readingMnemonic: Anything you don't <kanji>leave behind</kanji> will be stolen by <reading>ea</reading>gles (<ja>い</ja>). Eagles like shiny, valuable things, especially ones that are bouncing around on you while you scoot by on a scooter.
readingInfo: If you keep too many of your valuables on you, the eagles might not leave you behind either! They'll just pick you up off the scooter and carry you and your valuables off to their nests!
